headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM CENTRAL AMERICA; Settlement of the Transit Imbroglio. The Contract given to Com.Vanderbilt. The Vrissari and Herran Treaties in a Hopeless Condition.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the Moses Taylor, which arrived at this port yesterday from Aspinwall, we receive important news from Central and South America. The Nicaragua transit grant was signed on the 8th of May last in favor of Commodore VANDERBILT and his associates, and an " act of incorporation" places them on the footing of a corporate body.

docs.snippet: EMBEZZLEMEN.-WILLIAM EDMINDS, formerly a clerk in the employ of DANIEL C. ROBBINS, druggist, No. 91 Fulton-street, New-York, was arrested Saturday by Captain SMITH, of the First Precinct, on a charge of stealing from his employers. About $250 worth...
docs.lead_paragraph: EMBEZZLEMEN.-WILLIAM EDMINDS, formerly a clerk in the employ of DANIEL C. ROBBINS, druggist, No. 91 Fulton-street, New-York, was arrested Saturday by Captain SMITH, of the First Precinct, on a charge of stealing from his employers. About $250 worth of the stolen property was found at the residence of the accused, in this City. He was sent to New-York for examination.

docs.snippet: Tile steamship Moses Taylor, with the California mails of June 5th and over $1,700.000 in treasure, arrived at this port yesterday morning. We receive by this arrival later intelligence from Central and South America as well as from California and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tile steamship Moses Taylor, with the California mails of June 5th and over $1,700.000 in treasure, arrived at this port yesterday morning. We receive by this arrival later intelligence from Central and South America as well as from California and Oregon. The Central American news is important.

docs.snippet: The United States Mail Steamship Moses Tay lor, JOHN MCGOWAN, Esq., Commander, from Aspinwall, June 19, with the mails, treasure, and passengers, from San Francisco June 5, brought down by the Pacific Mail Steamship Golden Age arrived at this port at...

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE MOSES TAYLOR; $1,799,502 in Treasure. TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA. Destruction of Nevada by Fire. Exciting Accounts from the Frazer River Mines. Conflict Between U. S. Troops and Indians in Oregon. Three Offices and Fifty Men Reported Killed. VERY INTERESTING FROM UTAH. Particulars of the Exodus from the Salt Lake THE MORMONS RETURNING TO CARSON VALLEY.

docs.abstract: Procn. of Gov Douglas agt. Yankee Traders
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail Steamship Moses Tay lor, JOHN MCGOWAN, Esq., Commander, from Aspinwall, June 19, with the mails, treasure, and passengers, from San Francisco June 5, brought down by the Pacific Mail Steamship Golden Age arrived at this port at an early hour yesterday morning. The United States steam frigate Colorado, Commodore McINTOSH, arrived at Aspinwall on the 17th inst. at 4 P. M., from the City of San Domingo.

docs.snippet: The Vanderbilt steamship Ariel, Capt. LUDLOW, from Bremen, rid Southampton 16th inst., passed Cape Race at 4 P. M., yesterday, the 25th inst. She was intercepted off the Cape by the newrs-yacht of the New-York Associated Press, which arrived here...

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Loss of the Stramship New-York on the Coast of Scotland. Decline in Cotton-Breadatuffs DullConsols 96. THE ARIEL OFF CAPE RACE. FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Vanderbilt steamship Ariel, Capt. LUDLOW, from Bremen, rid Southampton 16th inst., passed Cape Race at 4 P. M., yesterday, the 25th inst. She was intercepted off the Cape by the newrs-yacht of the New-York Associated Press, which arrived here today, with a synopsis of her neews.

docs.lead_paragraph: The death of Edward Moxon, the poet's publisher, is announced in the London papers received bv the Persia. He was the friend of Charles Lamb, the elder Disraeli, Samuel Rogers, Barry Cornwall, Sheridan Knowles. Fanny Burney, Alonckton Milnes, John Forster and Tennyson. He was universally respected.

headline.main: The Great Atlantic Telegraph.; A DISTINGUISHED RUSSIAN GUEST ON BOARD THE NIAGARA--MINISTER SEYMOUR'S INTRODUCTION--LETTER FROM CAPTAIN HUDSON.

docs.abstract: Lieut Boye of the Russian Navy, on the Niagara
docs.lead_paragraph: Everything connected with the laying of the Atlantic Cable possesses a peculiar interest at this particular time. Lieutenant the Baron BOYE, who is now on board the Niagara, presented to Captain HUDSON the following letter of introduction from the Hon. THOMAS H. SEYMOUR, our Minister at St. Petersburg:

docs.snippet: The arrest of Captain JUDKINS,, of the Cunard steamship Persia, on the complaint of a Custom-House officer, who was prevented from returning to the Quarantine dock after boarding the ship on her last voyage to this City, has been made the subject of...

headline.main: United States Laws and Quarantine Regulations.

docs.lead_paragraph: The arrest of Captain JUDKINS,, of the Cunard steamship Persia, on the complaint of a Custom-House officer, who was prevented from returning to the Quarantine dock after boarding the ship on her last voyage to this City, has been made the subject of inquiry in the Imperial Parliament, and has also elicited considerable comment in the English papers.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; No Mail Between New-York and Vern Cruz--Movements of Members of the Diplomatic Corps--Treaty Between the Central American States-Court--Martial Sentence--Murder, & c. FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.abstract: Fall of a floor Wellsville N.Y
docs.lead_paragraph: The mail contract between New-Orleans and Vera Cruz, has just expired, and will not be renewed. The law now limits the pay to the postage received, and this will not secure the service. Senor MOLINO returned to Washington yesterday, improved in health.

headline.main: Brutal Treatment on Board an American Ship.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the London Times. On Wednesday last the first, second, and third mates of the United States ship Gleaner, named CUNNINGHAM. SUMMERS and BROWN, were brought up at the Police Court, Cardiff, on remand, charged with a series of brutal outrages upon the crew, consisting chiefly of negroes and colored men.
